intro: Epicostorus montanus, commonly known as the mountain epiphragm, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its botanical features include a slender stem and a unique arrangement of bracts that protect its reproductive structures. Due to its habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
